We believe that you should build for mixed reality, in mixed reality. This is a demo of MR.js includes surfaces, panels, UI layout, text, model loading and lighting. Surfaces are a way to anchor your app to a given plane. To place a surface, simply look at a wall or table, pinch your fingers to size it, and release. Panels are the basis of UI. They provide a way to organize your app UI in a way that your user is already familiar with Our UI layout implementation is modeled after containers, columns, and rows. A container will fit to the surface or panel it's parented to. When viewed on a 2D screen, the container will resize itself to the display. This provides a way to create spatial apps that can also be viewed on phones, tables, and desktops. As you can see here, our text implementation comes in clear and crisp thanks to Troika Text. This text window is also editable with full keyboard support. Finally we have models, images, and lighting support. You've already seen a few images loaded in this window and the other. But we also have support for loading 3D models! Here's our logo floating over the table. Lit using mr-light tags to give it some color. We've even implemented a custom system to add a rotation animation. We're still chugging along, but we're making great progress towards a usable 1.0 volumetrics
